p: The viscoelastic behavior of the formulations (ME and ME+EO) was evaluated by oscillatory measurements. Rheological analyses are relevant, as they provide parameters for the characterization of the formulations, including structure and viscosity, which are important for the development of formulations for topical use. 49 G′ represents the storage modulus of the energy of stress, which can be restored when the stress is released and G″ represents the flow resistance of the sample. 50
